controllers

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    2.0 ECSE 211 CTF Robot This class controls the navigation of the robot. It can travel to places, travel to places while avoiding blocks, and rotate. Originally written by: Sean Lawlor Ported to EV3 by: Francois Ouellet Delorme
    Author:
    TEAM 14

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Navigation(Odometer odo, WallAvoider avoider, UltrasonicPoller frontPoller, double wheelRadius, double wheelBase) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isRotating()
      Checks to see if either of the wheels is rotating
      void rotateFullCircle()
      This makes the robot rotate 360 degrees, and is used for light localization
      void setCmError(double cmErr)
      Sets the amount of positional error the robot can be off the final position (in cm)
      void setDegreeError(double deg)
      Sets the amount of degree error the robot can be off the final position (in deg)
      void setFastSpeed(int speed)
      Sets the traveling forward speed of the robot
      void setSlowSpeed(int speed)
      Sets the rotational speed of the robot
      void travelTo(double x, double y)
      Function that makes the robot travel to a position in the arena
      void travelToAndAvoid(double x, double y)
      Function that makes the robot travel to a position in the arena WHILE avoiding obstacles
      void turnTo(double angle, boolean stop)
      Turns the robot to face a certain orientation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigation

        public Navigation(Odometer odo,
          WallAvoider avoider,
          UltrasonicPoller frontPoller,
          double wheelRadius,
          double wheelBase)
        Parameters:
        odo - The odometer of the robot
        avoider - The wallavoider of the robot
        frontPoller - The frontfacing ultrasonic sensor
        wheelRadius - The radius of the wheels of the robot
        wheelBase - The distance between the two wheels

    • Method Detail

      • rotateFullCircle

        public void rotateFullCircle()
        This makes the robot rotate 360 degrees, and is used for light localization

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y)
        Function that makes the robot travel to a position in the arena
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the position
        y - The y coordinate of the position

      • travelToAndAvoid

        public void travelToAndAvoid(double x,
                    double y)
        Function that makes the robot travel to a position in the arena WHILE avoiding obstacles
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the position
        y - The y coordinate of the position

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double angle,
          boolean stop)
        Turns the robot to face a certain orientation.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle to face the robot (0 deg along x axis)
        stop - Whether to stop the robot after turning

      • setFastSpeed

        public void setFastSpeed(int speed)
        Sets the traveling forward speed of the robot
        Parameters:
        speed - How fast to turn the motors while traveling forward

      • setSlowSpeed

        public void setSlowSpeed(int speed)
        Sets the rotational speed of the robot
        Parameters:
        speed - How fast to turn the motors while rotating

      • setCmError

        public void setCmError(double cmErr)
        Sets the amount of positional error the robot can be off the final position (in cm)
        Parameters:
        cmErr - The amount of error allowed

      • setDegreeError

        public void setDegreeError(double deg)
        Sets the amount of degree error the robot can be off the final position (in deg)
        Parameters:
        deg - The amount of error allowed

      • isRotating

        public boolean isRotating()
        Checks to see if either of the wheels is rotating
        Returns:
        True if rotating
